Job Title: Director - Transformation Management Office

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Job Description:

Work within newly formed Transformation Management Office to drive transformational change of new initiatives, processes, business models or other critical elements of operation. Accountability to ensure close coordination across various departments to align operational execution with organizational objectives. This involves working directly with multiple teams at all levels. Cross functional teams include people and culture, procurement, corporate IT, product development, engineering, customer service, customer success, and GTM functions. This role acts as a conduit between the organization's strategic ambitions and its operational capabilities to ensure strategic alignment of transformation activities that will deliver value.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Strategic planning and execution -Strategic alignment of business plans into transformation programs to ensure prioritized sequencing of opportunities that will deliver strategic value.Portfolio, program, and operational focus demonstrating progress against strategic roadmaps through governance, planning, organizational processes, controls, and performance management.Provide hands on support and expertise to ensure large transformation/change initiatives have clearly articulated business cases, business objectives, measurable key results and realized value.Program Execution -Program and change management to deliver value on cross functional initiatives and activities.Plan across multiple roadmaps to manage sequencing, dependencies, risks and milestones throughout execution.Define & Monitor KPIs to measure transformation success and alignment to strategic goals and overall priority.Enable adoption of change within program scope through developing, disseminating and tracking business readiness plansOperational Enablement -Business process optimization as part of effectively delivering end-to-end value. Documenting Enterprise Operational Value Streams and L2 Value Streams to drive efficiency and deliver root-cause fixes.Lead enterprise performance management practices by preparing and facilitating organizational accountability and goal achievement meetings monthly, quarterly, and annually (QBR, OKR, etc)Drive operational excellence by developing key insights (ops/reporting/dashboarding) and data driven decision making


SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Determine appropriate resourcing of staff to achieve goals and objectives.Define annual Key Performance Indicators aligned with corporate goals.Coach direct reports on performance gaps, career development opportunities, and strategies.Own attainment of high employee satisfaction and retention; lead development of program and initiatives within group to attain high employee satisfaction.Prepare and manage budget as assigned; analyzes variances and initiates corrective actions to maximize operational performance.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Experience in the following disciplines:Strategic realizationProgram and Project ManagementChange ManagementBusiness Process OptimizationData and AnalyticsAbility to listen and understand information and communicate the same.Must possess good organizational skills.Must be results oriented, customer focused, and exhibit good interpersonal skills.Proficiency in Microsoft office packages.


EDUCATION AND TRAINING:

Bachelor’s degree in Business or related field10 plus years of technical and business work experience, with 5 plus years of experience in a management/leadership role, preferably in project management or enterprise business analysis5-7 years of experience in program management or operational management rolesOr equivalent combination of education and/or experience


Other Qualifications

The Winning Way behaviors that all Vertex employees need in order to meet the expectations of each other, our customers, and our partners.

 Communicate with Clarity - Be clear, concise and actionable. Be relentlessly constructive. Seek and provide meaningful feedback. Act with Urgency - Adopt an agile mentality - frequent iterations, improved speed, resilience. 80/20 rule – better is the enemy of done. Don’t spend hours when minutes are enough. Work with Purpose - Exhibit a “We Can” mindset. Results outweigh effort. Everyone understands how their role contributes. Set aside personal objectives for team results. Drive to Decision - Cut the swirl with defined deadlines and decision points. Be clear on individual accountability and decision authority. Guided by a commitment to and accountability for customer outcomes. Own the Outcome - Defined milestones, commitments and intended results. Assess your work in context, if you’re unsure, ask. Demonstrate unwavering support for decisions.


COMMENTS:

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals in this position. Other functions may be assigned, and management retains the right to add or change the duties at any time.

Experience Level (if available): Director
